CatDescriptText: Mr. Tony Upsher, parking lot operator, 32 Roberts Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 12, 1957, pg. 2 with question: "Do you think the Little Rock, Ark. school integration incident will gain more financial support for the NAACP in its continuing fight for equal rights?"  Answer reads: "In my personal opinion, I think it will, because the NAACP is aggressive in leading the fight against segregation."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Tony Upsher wearing light colored cap and vest, standing with hands on hips in front of building with glass block window and sign reading "...a's Corner"
